Trial_Design.evidence: Patients were randomly allocated to intubate with one of the three laryngoscopes

Participants.evidence: Forty-five American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) I-II adult patients, with Mallampati grade 1–4, requiring NTI, were enrolled after taking written informed consent.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomly allocated to intubate with one of the three laryngoscopes (McCoy, Macintosh, and Truview)

Objective.evidence: The purpose of this study was to evaluate the performance of McCoy, Macintosh, and Truview laryngoscopes during bougie-aided NTI

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was intubation time

Number_Randomised.evidence: Forty-five American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) I-II adult patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intubation time of McCoy, Macintosh, and Truview, was 86.87 ± 15.92, 82.87 ± 16.46, and 79.93 ± 14.53 (mean ± standard deviation) seconds
